definition: down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
classifier for a ream of paper
to order/to command/an order/warrant/writ/to cause/to make sth happen/virtuous/honorific title/season/government position (old)

sentences.english: I commanded the voice before terror could incapacitate me.
sentences.chinese: 我趕在恐懼擊倒我以前對那個聲音下令。

sentences.english: He ordered the cortege to stop.
State-owned newspapers have been ordered to downplay the story.
sentences.chinese: 國有的新聞報紙被下令對錢案進行低調處理。

sentences.english: King Nedega was very upset and ordered that she be locked up.
sentences.chinese: 內德加國王非常不高興，便下令把她關起來。

sentences.english: When Washington ordered troops into the area, the opposition collapsed without a fight.
sentences.chinese: 在華盛頓下令軍隊開進該地區時，抗爭者不戰而散。

sentences.english: So the king ordered that the marriage of the shepherd and the princess take place without delay.
sentences.chinese: 於是王下令，該牧羊人和公主的婚姻採取不拖延。

sentences.english: The general commanded his men to attack the city.
Last week she ordered a halt to all dismissals of gay service members.
sentences.chinese: 上週，該法官下令暫停解僱所有同性戀服役人員。

sentences.english: By 1525, the authorities ordered that all oceangoing vessels be destroyed.
sentences.chinese: 1525年，中國下令毀掉所有遠洋船隻。

sentences.english: The Railway Ministry has also ordered a two-month safety review of railway operations.
sentences.chinese: 鐵道部長也已經下令將開展爲期兩個月的安全檢查。

sentences.english: He is ordering flags at all government buildings to be flown at half-staff in honor of the victims.
sentences.chinese: 他已下令所有政府大樓降半旗悼念遇難者。

sentences.english: Prof. Humphrey instruct his student to obey the experimental rules.
sentences.chinese: 韓福教授下令學生遵守實驗規則。

sentences.english: In hopes of fighting off the disease, he ordered unending prayer and parades of chanters through the streets.
sentences.chinese: 爲了與病魔做鬥爭，教皇下令祈禱者沿街遊行吟唱。

sentences.english: He was sentenced to death but was reprieved by the president.
sentences.chinese: 他被判處死刑但被總統下令緩期執行。

sentences.english: In the Han Emperor, has been ordered fifteenth day as the Lantern Festival.
sentences.chinese: 在漢文帝時，已下令將正月十五定爲元宵節。

sentences.english: The regiment commander ordered ( or gave orders for) an emergency muster.

definition: an execution/to put sb to death
to shout an order or command
to transmit down (a chain of command)/to pass down (to lower level)/to issue/to send through
against orders/to disobey/to refuse to accept orders
to receive orders/to follow orders/to act under orders
